info.name: Foody API - Manual Testing Collection
info.description:
# Comprehensive GraphQL API Collection for Manual Testing

## Overview
Complete endpoint coverage for testing all Foody API features:
- User authentication & authorization
- Restaurant management & discovery
- Menu item browsing & management  
- Order creation & tracking
- Payment processing & methods
- User administration (admin only)

## Quick Start
1. **Login First**: Use Login endpoint with admin@foody.com / ChangeMe123!
2. **Copy Token**: From response, save JWT to `{{auth_token`
3. **Use Variables**: All subsequent requests use collection variables
4. **Execute Sequentially**: Follow the folder order for proper workflow

## Key Features
‚úÖ Proper GraphQL variables - all requests use parameterized queries
‚úÖ Collection variables defined - restaurantId, menuItemId, orderId, paymentMethodId
‚úÖ Organized by feature folders (Authentication, Restaurants, Orders, etc.)
‚úÖ Flexible variable setup - manual copy/paste from responses
‚úÖ Built-in error handling and response validation
‚úÖ No hardcoded test data - use provided examples as templates

## Authentication & Tokens
- Most endpoints require Bearer token authentication
- Login/Register requests return token in response
- Copy token from response to `{{auth_token` variable
- All authenticated requests use: `Authorization: Bearer {{auth_token`
- Token valid for 24 hours

## Roles & Permissions Matrix

| Role | View Restaurants | Create/Edit Items | Create Orders | Update Orders | Admin Functions |
|------|------------------|-------------------|---------------|----------------|-----------------|
| ADMIN | All restaurants | Any restaurant | Any restaurant | Any restaurant | Yes |
| MANAGER | Assigned restaurant only | Assigned restaurant only | Assigned restaurant only | Assigned restaurant only | No |
| MEMBER | Assigned restaurant only | No | Assigned restaurant (cart only) | No | No |

## Testing Workflow (Recommended Order)
1. **Auth**: Login to get token (copy to `{{auth_token`)
2. **Restaurants**: Browse/create restaurants (copy IDs to variables)
3. **Menu Items**: Browse/create menu items (copy IDs to variables)
4. **Payment Methods**: Create payment method (copy ID to variable)
5. **Orders**: Create order with items (copy ID to variable)
6. **Payments**: Process payment for order (copy ID to variable)
7. **Tracking**: Update order status and view results

## Important Notes
- **Members Can Create Carts**: Members may create orders for their assigned restaurant but cannot attach payment methods or update status
- **Restaurant Restrictions**: Managers and members operate within their assigned restaurant (based on `restaurantId`)
- **Variables Are Essential**: Copy IDs from Create responses to use in subsequent operations
- **GraphQL Variables**: All requests use proper GraphQL variables (not inline values)
- **No Auto-Capture**: Manually copy values from responses to collection variables
- **Production Use**: Update email/password before using in production

## Test User Credentials
```
Admin (Global): admin@foody.com / ChangeMe123!
Manager (Spice Garden - restaurant-india-1): captain.marvel@foody.com / ChangeMe123!
Member (Spice Garden - restaurant-india-1): thanos@foody.com / ChangeMe123!
```

## Collection Variables
- `baseUrl`: API base URL (default: http://localhost:4000)
- `graphql`: GraphQL endpoint (default: baseUrl/graphql)
- `auth_token`: JWT token (auto-set after login)
- `restaurant_id`: Current restaurant ID (set after create/view)
- `menu_item_id`: Current menu item ID (set after create/view)
- `order_id`: Current order ID (set after create/view)
- `payment_method_id`: Current payment method ID (set after create/view)
- `user_id`: User ID for update and delete testing (copy from Login/Register response)

**Version:** 3.1.0  
**Last Updated:** November 17, 2025  
**Type:** Manual Testing Collection - Consistent & Variable-Based

variable.description: Base URL for the API server
JWT authentication token (copy from Login/Register response)
User ID for update and delete testing (copy from Login/Register response)
Sample restaurant ID (copy from Create Restaurant or Get Restaurants response)
Sample menu item ID (copy from Create Menu Item or Get Menu Items response)
Sample order ID (copy from Create Order or Get Orders response)
Sample payment method ID (copy from Create Payment Method response)
Sample payment ID (copy from Process Payment response)

item.name: 01 - Authentication
item.description:
## User Authentication & Session Management

### Overview
Handle user registration (admin-only), login, and session management. Login returns JWT tokens for protected endpoint access.

### Key Points
- **Register**: Admin-only operation (requires admin authentication)
- **Login**: Public endpoint (no authentication required)
- **Token in Response**: Token returned in response data
- **Session Duration**: JWT tokens valid for 24 hours
- **Manual Token Setup**: Copy token from response to `{{auth_token}}` variable

### Test Users (Pre-seeded)
Use these credentials if database is seeded:
- **Admin (Global)**: admin@foody.com / ChangeMe123!
- **Manager (Spice Garden)**: captain.marvel@foody.com / ChangeMe123!
- **Member (Spice Garden)**: thanos@foody.com / ChangeMe123!

### Workflow
1. **Login**: Authenticate with existing credentials
   - Copy token from response to use in Authorization header
   - Ready for protected endpoints
2. **Register** (Admin only): Create new user account
   - Must be logged in as admin first
   - Assign user to a valid restaurant
   - Choose role (MANAGER or MEMBER only)
   - Copy token from response to test new user
3. **Me Query**: Verify authentication
   - Confirms token validity
   - Shows current user role and permissions

### Response Handling
- ‚úÖ Token returned in response.data.register.token or response.data.login.token
- ‚úÖ Copy and save to `{{auth_token}}` variable for subsequent requests
- ‚úÖ User ID in response.data.register.user.id or response.data.login.user.id

### Error Scenarios
- **Invalid Credentials**: Generic error (prevents user enumeration)
- **Inactive Account**: User cannot login if deactivated
- **Token Expired**: Use Login again to get new token
- **Register Without Admin**: Returns forbidden error
- **Invalid Restaurant**: Registration fails if restaurant doesn't exist

request.description:
**Admin-Only Operation**: Register a new user account and assign them to a restaurant.

**Authentication Required:**
- Must be logged in as ADMIN
- Use admin credentials: admin@foody.com / ChangeMe123!

**Available Roles:**
- MANAGER: Manage operations for their assigned restaurant
- MEMBER: Create carts and view data within their assigned restaurant
- ‚ö†Ô∏è ADMIN: Cannot be created via this endpoint (manual provisioning only)

**Restaurant Assignment:**
- **Required** for all new users (managers and members)
- Must be valid restaurant ID from database
- Valid IDs: `restaurant-india-1` (Spice Garden Bangalore), `restaurant-america-1` (Burger Haven)
- Restaurant existence is validated before account creation

**Password Requirements:**
- Minimum 8 characters
- Must contain uppercase, lowercase, and numbers

**Response:**
- Returns JWT token for the new user
- Copy token to `{{auth_token}}` to test with new user account

Authenticate user and receive JWT token.

**On Success:**
- Token is automatically saved to environment/collection variables
- Token is valid for 24 hours
- Use token in Authorization header for protected endpoints

**Error Cases:**
- Invalid credentials: Returns generic error to prevent user enumeration
- Inactive account: User cannot login if account is deactivated

Retrieve currently authenticated user's profile information.

**Authentication:** Required

**Use Cases:**
- Verify token validity
- Get current user role and permissions
- Display user profile information

item.name: 02 - Restaurants
item.description:
## Restaurant Discovery & Management

### Overview
Browse restaurants, view details with full menus, and manage restaurants (admin only).

### Permissions
| Operation | Admin | Manager | Member |
|-----------|-------|---------|--------|
| View (Filtered) | All restaurants | Assigned restaurant only | Assigned restaurant only |
| Create | ‚úÖ | ‚ùå | ‚ùå |
| Update | ‚úÖ | ‚ùå | ‚ùå |
| Delete | ‚úÖ | ‚ùå | ‚ùå |

### Restaurant Access
- **Admin**: See ALL restaurants globally
- **Managers**: See ONLY their assigned restaurant (via `restaurantId`)
- **Members**: See only their assigned restaurant

### Workflow
1. **List Restaurants**: Get paginated restaurant list
   - Automatically filtered by user's assigned restaurant (except admin)
   - Uses `{{restaurant_id}}` variable for subsequent requests
2. **View Details**: Get restaurant with full menu
   - Shows all menu items and categories
   - Required before creating menu items
3. **Create** (Admin only): Add new restaurant
   - Returned ID auto-saved to `{{restaurant_id}}`
4. **Update** (Admin only): Modify restaurant details
   - Partial updates supported
5. **Delete** (Admin only): Remove restaurant
   - Cascades to delete menu items

### Important Notes
- ‚ö†Ô∏è Managers cannot create restaurants
- ‚ö†Ô∏è Members can only view restaurants
- ‚ö†Ô∏è Delete cascades to all menu items
- üí° Always get restaurant details before creating menu items

graphql.query:
query Restaurants($location: String, $first: Int, $skip: Int) {
  restaurants(location: $location, first: $first, skip: $skip) {
    id
    name
    description
    address
    city
    location
    phone
    email
    isActive
    menuCategories
    createdAt
    updatedAt
  }
}

request.description:
List all restaurants with pagination and optional location filtering.

**Access Control:**
- **Admin**: Can view all restaurants globally
- **Managers**: Automatically filtered to show ONLY their assigned restaurant
- **Members**: Automatically filtered to show ONLY their assigned restaurant

**Restaurant Filtering:**
- Backend automatically applies restaurant-based filtering for non-admin users
- Managers and members cannot override this filter
- Admin users can optionally filter by location parameter

**Pagination:**
- first: Number of items to return (default: 10)
- skip: Number to skip for pagination (default: 0)

**Response:**
- Includes restaurant details and available menu categories
- Menu items are included with available status

graphql.query:
query Restaurant($id: ID!) {
  restaurant(id: $id) {
    id
    name
    description
    address
    city
    location
    phone
    email
    isActive
    menuItems {
      id
      name
      description
      price
      isAvailable
      category
      imageUrl
    }
    menuCategories
    createdAt
    updatedAt
  }
}

request.description:
Get detailed information about a specific restaurant including its full menu.

**Includes:**
- Restaurant information and contact details
- All available menu items with pricing and categories
- Complete list of menu categories

**Access Control:**
- **Admin**: Can view any restaurant by ID
- **Managers**: Can only view their assigned restaurant
- **Members**: Can only view their assigned restaurant
- Attempting to access another restaurant returns access denied error

**Use Cases:**
- View complete restaurant menu before placing orders
- Browse available items and categories
- Check restaurant contact information

graphql.query:
mutation CreateRestaurant($input: CreateRestaurantInput!) {
  createRestaurant(input: $input) {
    id
    name
    description
    address
    city
    location
    phone
    email
    isActive
    createdAt
    updatedAt
  }
}

request.description:
Create a new restaurant in the system.

**Permissions:** Admin only

**Required Fields:**
- name: Restaurant name
- description: Description of the restaurant
- address: Physical address
- city: City name
- location: Location identifier (used for filtering)
- phone: Contact phone number
- email: Contact email address

**Restaurant ID:**
- Generated automatically by the system
- Use format: restaurant-{region}-{number} for consistency
- Example: restaurant-india-1, restaurant-america-1

**Location Field:**
- Used for geographic filtering and grouping
- Can be city name, area, or custom identifier
- Example: "bangalore", "new-york", "downtown"

**Tip:** Copy the restaurant ID from response to use in `{{restaurant_id}}` for subsequent requests

Update existing restaurant information.

**Permissions:** Admin only

**Updatable Fields:**
- All restaurant fields are optional in update
- Partial updates supported

Permanently delete a restaurant.

**Permissions:** Admin only

**Warning:** This action cannot be undone and will cascade delete related menu items.

item.name: 03 - Menu Items
item.description:
## Menu Item Discovery, Management & Categories

### Overview
Browse menu items across restaurants, view detailed item information, discover food categories, and manage menu offerings (admin/manager only).

### Permissions
| Operation | Admin | Manager | Member |
|-----------|-------|---------|--------|
| View Items | All restaurants | Assigned restaurant only | Assigned restaurant only |
| View Categories | All categories | All categories | All categories |
| Create/Update/Delete | ‚úÖ | Assigned restaurant only | ‚ùå |

### Restaurant Scope
- **Admin**: Can manage menu items for ALL restaurants globally
- **Managers**: Can only manage menu items for their assigned restaurant
- **Members**: Can only view menu items from their assigned restaurant

### Workflow
1. **Browse Menu Items**: Get paginated menu items with optional restaurant filtering
   - Automatically filtered by user's assigned restaurant (except admin)
   - Shows only available items (isAvailable: true)
2. **View Item Details**: Get complete menu item information
   - Includes restaurant details and pricing
3. **Explore Categories**: Discover available food categories
   - Filter by restaurant or get all categories
   - Useful for building category-based navigation
4. **Create Items** (Manager/Admin): Add new menu items
   - Must specify restaurant ID
   - Returned ID saved to `{{menu_item_id}}`
5. **Update Items** (Manager/Admin): Modify existing items
   - Partial updates supported
   - Restaurant restrictions apply
6. **Delete Items** (Manager/Admin): Remove menu items
   - Permanent action
   - Restaurant restrictions apply

### Important Notes
- ‚ö†Ô∏è Managers cannot manage menu items outside their assigned restaurant
- ‚ö†Ô∏è Members can only view, not modify menu items
- ‚ö†Ô∏è Menu items must belong to existing restaurants
- üí° Always verify restaurant details before creating menu items
- üí° Use categories for better menu organization and user experience
- üìä Menu items include pricing, availability, and categorization

request.description:
List available menu items with optional restaurant filtering.

**Access Control:**
- **Admin**: Can view menu items from all restaurants
- **Managers**: Automatically filtered to ONLY their assigned restaurant's items
- **Members**: Automatically filtered to ONLY their assigned restaurant's items

**Restaurant Filtering:**
- Backend automatically applies restaurant scoping for non-admin users
- Managers and members cannot access menu items from other restaurants
- Admin users can optionally specify restaurantId to filter results
- Only shows available items (isAvailable: true)

**Pagination:**
- first: Items per page (default: 10)
- skip: Items to skip (default: 0)

**Response:**
- Includes menu item details (name, description, price, category)
- Associated restaurant information
- Availability status and images

graphql.query:
query MenuItem($id: ID!) {
  menuItem(id: $id) {
    id
    name
    description
    price
    imageUrl
    isAvailable
    category
    restaurant {
      id
      name
      address
      city
      location
      phone
    }
    createdAt
    updatedAt
  }
}

request.description:
Get comprehensive details about a specific menu item.

**Includes:**
- Complete menu item information (name, description, price)
- Availability status and category
- Associated restaurant details
- Image URL and metadata

**Access Control:**
- Users can only view menu items for their assigned restaurant (except admin)

Get list of unique menu categories.

**Filtering:**
- restaurantId: Get categories for specific restaurant (optional)
- If null, returns all categories across all restaurants

**Use Cases:**
- Build category filter UI
- Discover food types available

Create a new menu item for a restaurant.

**Permissions:**
- **Admin**: Can create menu items for any restaurant globally
- **Managers**: Can ONLY create menu items for their assigned restaurant
- **Members**: Cannot create menu items (read-only access)

**Restaurant Restrictions:**
- Managers must create items within their assigned restaurant
- Attempting to create items for another restaurant returns access denied
- Restaurant must exist in the database

**Required Fields:**
- name: Menu item name
- description: Item description
- price: Price in currency units (e.g., 599.99)
- category: Food category (e.g., "Main Course", "Dessert")
- restaurantId: ID of the restaurant this item belongs to

**Optional Fields:**
- imageUrl: URL to item image
- isAvailable: Availability status (default: true)

**Tip:** Copy the menu item ID from response to use in `{{menu_item_id}}` for subsequent requests

Update existing menu item.

**Permissions:**
- **Admin**: Can update menu items in any restaurant
- **Managers**: Can ONLY update menu items in their assigned restaurant
- **Members**: Cannot update menu items

**Restaurant Restrictions:**
- Menu item must belong to manager's assigned restaurant
- Attempting to update items from other restaurants returns access denied

**Updatable Fields:**
- All fields are optional (partial updates supported)
- name, description, price, category, imageUrl, isAvailable

**Common Use Cases:**
- Toggle availability (mark item as unavailable)
- Update pricing
- Modify descriptions or categories

Permanently delete a menu item.

**Permissions:**
- **Admin**: Can delete menu items from any restaurant
- **Managers**: Can ONLY delete menu items from their assigned restaurant
- **Members**: Cannot delete menu items

**Restaurant Restrictions:**
- Menu item must belong to manager's assigned restaurant
- Attempting to delete items from other restaurants returns access denied

**Warning:** This action cannot be undone. Consider marking items as unavailable instead of deleting.

item.name: 04 - Payment Methods
item.description:
## Payment Method Management & Security

### Overview
Manage payment methods for secure order processing. **Only admins and managers** can save and manage payment options.

### Permissions
| Operation | Admin | Manager | Member |
|-----------|-------|---------|--------|
| View Own Methods | ‚úÖ | ‚úÖ | ‚ùå |
| Create Methods | ‚úÖ | ‚úÖ | ‚ùå |
| Update Methods | ‚úÖ | ‚úÖ | ‚ùå |
| Delete Methods | ‚úÖ | ‚úÖ | ‚ùå |

### Security Model
- **User Isolation**: Users can only access their own payment methods
- **Token-Based**: Payment details are tokenized for security
- **Provider Integration**: Supports Stripe, PayPal, and Razorpay
- **Role Restriction**: Members cannot access payment method operations

### Workflow
1. **List Payment Methods** (Admin/Manager): View saved payment options
   - Shows all user's payment methods
   - Indicates default method
   - Ordered by creation date
2. **View Method Details** (Admin/Manager): Get specific payment method information
   - Includes masked card numbers (last 4 digits)
   - Shows provider and type
3. **Add Payment Method** (Admin/Manager): Save new payment option
   - Requires payment provider token
   - Can set as default automatically
   - Returned ID saved to `{{payment_method_id}}`
4. **Update Method** (Admin/Manager): Modify payment settings
   - Currently supports default status only
   - Setting default unsets other defaults
5. **Remove Method** (Admin/Manager): Delete payment option
   - Permanent action
   - Cannot delete if used in pending orders

### Important Notes
- üîí Payment data is tokenized and never stored in plain text
- üí≥ Supports credit cards, debit cards, and digital wallets
- üåê Multiple payment providers supported (Stripe, PayPal, Razorpay)
- ‚≠ê Only one default payment method allowed per user
- ‚ö†Ô∏è Payment methods cannot be deleted if associated with active orders
- üîë In production, tokens come from payment provider SDK integration
- üö´ **Members cannot create or manage payment methods** - they can only create carts
- üíº Managers must have restaurant assignment to access payment methods

request.description:
Get all payment methods for the current user.

**Permissions:**
- **Admin**: ‚úÖ Can view their own payment methods
- **Managers**: ‚úÖ Can view their own payment methods (requires restaurant assignment)
- **Members**: ‚ùå Access denied - members cannot manage payment methods

**Returns:**
- User's saved payment methods
- Masked card information (last 4 digits)
- Default payment method indicator
- Ordered by creation date (newest first)

**Error Cases:**
- Returns forbidden error if called by member
- Returns forbidden error if manager lacks restaurant assignment

Retrieve detailed information about a specific payment method.

**Includes:**
- Payment method type and provider
- Masked card number (last 4 digits)
- Default status indicator
- Creation and update timestamps

**Permissions:**
- **Admin**: ‚úÖ Can view their own payment methods
- **Managers**: ‚úÖ Can view their own payment methods
- **Members**: ‚ùå Access denied

**Access Control:** Users can only view their own payment methods. Attempting to access another user's payment method returns not found error.

Add a new payment method for the current user.

**Permissions:**
- **Admin**: ‚úÖ Can create payment methods
- **Managers**: ‚úÖ Can create payment methods (requires restaurant assignment)
- **Members**: ‚ùå Access denied - use carts instead

**Payment Types:**
- CREDIT_CARD
- DEBIT_CARD
- DIGITAL_WALLET

**Providers:**
- STRIPE
- PAYPAL
- RAZORPAY

**Default Method:**
- Set isDefault to true to make this the default payment method
- Setting a new default automatically unsets previous default

**Note:** In production, token would come from payment provider SDK. Copy the payment method ID from response to use in `{{payment_method_id}}`

Update payment method settings (currently only supports setting default).

**Permissions:**
- **Admin**: ‚úÖ Can update their own payment methods
- **Managers**: ‚úÖ Can update their own payment methods
- **Members**: ‚ùå Access denied

**Updatable Fields:**
- isDefault: Set as default payment method

**Note:** Setting a method as default will automatically unset all other defaults for the user

Remove a payment method.

**Permissions:**
- **Admin**: ‚úÖ Can delete their own payment methods
- **Managers**: ‚úÖ Can delete their own payment methods
- **Members**: ‚ùå Access denied

**Access:** User can only delete their own payment methods

**Warning:** Cannot delete payment methods associated with active/pending orders

item.name: 05 - Orders
item.description:
## Order Lifecycle Management & Tracking

### Overview
Complete order management system with creation, status tracking, and administrative controls. Supports the full order lifecycle from placement to delivery.

### Permissions
| Operation | Admin | Manager | Member |
|-----------|-------|---------|--------|
| View Orders | All orders | Assigned restaurant orders | Own orders only |
| Create Orders | ‚úÖ | Assigned restaurant only | Assigned restaurant (cart only) |
| Update Status | ‚úÖ | Assigned restaurant only | ‚ùå |
| Cancel Orders | ‚úÖ | Assigned restaurant only | ‚ùå |

### Order Status Flow
```mermaid
PENDING ‚Üí CONFIRMED ‚Üí PREPARING ‚Üí OUT_FOR_DELIVERY ‚Üí DELIVERED
    ‚Üì
CANCELLED
```

### Restaurant Restrictions
- **Admin**: Can manage ALL orders globally
- **Managers**: Can only manage orders for their assigned restaurant
- **Members**: Can create carts for their assigned restaurant but cannot attach payment methods or update/cancel orders

### Workflow
1. **Browse Orders**: Get paginated order list
   - Access control based on user role
   - Includes order status and basic details
2. **View Order Details**: Get complete order information
   - Full item details, payment info, delivery address
   - Order history and timestamps
3. **Create Order** (Admin/Manager/Member): Place new order or cart
   - Validates menu item availability
   - Calculates total amount automatically
   - Members submit carts without payment method
4. **Attach Payment & Update Status** (Manager/Admin): Progress orders through lifecycle
   - Payment methods must belong to the order owner
   - Status transitions follow predefined flow
5. **Cancel Order** (Manager/Admin): Cancel existing order when required
   - Sets status to CANCELLED
   - May trigger refund processes

### Important Notes
- ‚ö†Ô∏è Orders must use menu items from the assigned restaurant for managers/members
- ‚ö†Ô∏è Only managers/admins can attach payment methods, update status, or cancel orders
- ÔøΩ Members can start carts that managers/admins later complete
- ÔøΩ Orders automatically cache results for performance
- üì¶ Delivery address and contact info required for all orders

request.description:
Get paginated list of orders.

**Access Control:**
- Members: Only their own carts/orders
- Managers: Orders within their assigned restaurant
- Admin: All orders

**Order Status:**
- PENDING, CONFIRMED, PREPARING, OUT_FOR_DELIVERY, DELIVERED, CANCELLED

Get detailed information about a specific order including all items and payment details.

**Access Control:** Same as orders list query

Create a new order or cart with menu items.

**Who can use this request?**
- Admin/Manager: Provide `paymentMethodId` to submit a payable order
- Member: Leave `paymentMethodId` as null to create a cart in their assigned restaurant

**Restaurant Restrictions:**
- Managers and members must use menu items from their assigned restaurant
- Admin users have no restaurant restriction

**Process:**
1. Validates all menu items are available
2. Calculates total amount
3. Optionally verifies payment method (admin/manager only)
4. Creates order atomically in transaction
5. Returns order with calculated totals

**Tip:** Copy the order ID from response to use in `{{order_id}}` for subsequent requests

Update the status of an order.

**Permissions:**
- **Admin**: Can update any order status globally
- **Managers**: Can ONLY update orders in their assigned restaurant
- **Members**: Cannot update order status

**Restaurant Access** (Managers):
- Can update orders where the user belongs to their restaurant
- Can update orders where order items belong to their restaurant
- Access denied for orders outside their restaurant scope

**Status Values:**
- PENDING: Initial order state
- CONFIRMED: Order accepted and confirmed
- PREPARING: Kitchen is preparing the order
- OUT_FOR_DELIVERY: Order is on the way
- DELIVERED: Order successfully delivered
- CANCELLED: Order cancelled

**Typical Flow:**
PENDING to CONFIRMED to PREPARING to OUT_FOR_DELIVERY to DELIVERED

Cancel an existing order.

**Permissions:**
- **Admin**: Can cancel any order globally
- **Managers**: Can ONLY cancel orders in their assigned restaurant
- **Members**: Cannot cancel orders

**Restaurant Access** (Managers):
- Can cancel orders where the user belongs to their restaurant
- Can cancel orders where order items belong to their restaurant  
- Access denied for orders outside their restaurant scope

**Effect:** Sets order status to CANCELLED

**Note:** Consider refund processing in production systems

item.name: 06 - Payments
item.description:
## Payment Processing & Transaction Management

### Overview
Handle payment processing for orders with secure transaction handling, status tracking, and comprehensive payment records.

### Permissions
| Operation | Admin | Manager | Member |
|-----------|-------|---------|--------|
| View Own Payments | ‚ùå | ‚ùå | ‚úÖ |
| Process Payments | ‚ùå | ‚ùå | ‚úÖ (own orders) |
| View All Payments | ‚úÖ | ‚ùå | ‚ùå |
| View Payment Details | Own payments | ‚ùå | Own payments |

### Payment Flow
```mermaid
Order Created ‚Üí Payment Method Selected ‚Üí Payment Processed ‚Üí Transaction Recorded
```

### Security & Integration
- **Provider Integration**: Supports Stripe, PayPal, and Razorpay
- **Token Security**: Payment methods use secure tokens
- **Transaction Tracking**: Unique transaction IDs for all payments
- **Audit Trail**: Complete payment history with timestamps

### Workflow
1. **View Payment History** (Admin): System-wide payment records
   - Financial reporting and reconciliation
   - Transaction auditing capabilities
   - Includes payment methods and order details
2. **View Payment Details**: Get specific payment information
   - Complete transaction details
   - Associated order and payment method
   - Transaction status and timestamps
3. **Process Payment**: Execute payment for order
   - Validates order ownership and payment method
   - Prevents duplicate payments
   - Creates transaction record
   - Returns payment details with transaction ID
   - Payment ID saved to `{{payment_id}}`

### Important Notes
- üí∞ Payments are processed only for user's own orders
- üîí Payment processing includes ownership validation
- üö´ Duplicate payments prevented by order-payment relationship
- üåê Supports multiple payment providers (Stripe, PayPal, Razorpay)
- üìä Transaction IDs provided for payment reconciliation
- ‚ö†Ô∏è Production integration requires webhook handling
- üîÑ Async payment processing recommended for production
- üí≥ Payment methods must be pre-created and owned by user
- üìà Admin can view all payments for system oversight

request.description:
Get all payments in the system.

**Permissions:** Admin only

**Use Cases:**
- Financial reporting
- Transaction auditing
- Payment reconciliation

Get comprehensive details about a specific payment transaction.

**Includes:**
- Payment amount and status
- Associated payment method (masked)
- Linked order information
- Transaction ID for reconciliation
- Complete audit trail with timestamps

**Access Control:**
- Users can view their own payments
- Admin can view all payments in the system

Process payment for an order.

**Requirements:**
- Order must exist and belong to user
- Payment method must exist and belong to user
- Order must not already have a payment

**Process:**
1. Validates order and payment method ownership
2. Checks for existing payment on order
3. Processes payment (simulated in current version)
4. Creates payment record with transaction ID
5. Returns payment details

**Production Notes:**
- Integrate with real payment gateway (Stripe/PayPal/Razorpay)
- Implement webhook handling for async updates
- Add idempotency keys for retry safety

**Tip:** Copy the payment ID from response to use in `{{payment_id}}` for subsequent requests

## User Administration & System Management

### Overview
Comprehensive user management system for administrators to oversee user accounts, roles, permissions, and system access controls.

### Permissions
| Operation | Admin | Manager | Member |
|-----------|-------|---------|--------|
| View All Users | ‚úÖ | ‚ùå | ‚ùå |
| View User Details | ‚úÖ | ‚ùå | ‚ùå |
| Update Users | ‚úÖ | ‚ùå | ‚ùå |
| Delete Users | ‚úÖ | ‚ùå | ‚ùå |

### User Roles & Access
- **ADMIN**: Full system access, user management, global operations
- **MANAGER**: Restaurant and order management within an assigned restaurant
- **MEMBER**: Read-only access within an assigned restaurant

### Restaurant Assignment
- **Scoped Access**: Managers and members must be tied to a specific restaurant
- **Access Control**: Restaurant dictates which menu items and orders they can manage
- **Admin Override**: Admin users have global access without restrictions

### Workflow
1. **List All Users**: Get paginated user directory
   - Complete user list with roles and status
   - Pagination for large user bases
   - Filter and search capabilities
2. **View User Details**: Get comprehensive user profile
   - Profile information and account status
   - Order history and payment methods
   - Activity and access patterns
3. **Update User**: Modify user attributes
   - Change role assignments
   - Update assigned restaurants
   - Activate/deactivate accounts
4. **Delete User**: Permanently remove user account
   - Cascades to related data
   - Requires careful consideration

### Important Notes
- üëë **Admin Only**: All user management operations require admin privileges
- üçΩÔ∏è Assigned restaurants control access scope for managers and members
- üîÑ Role changes take effect immediately
- ‚ö†Ô∏è User deletion is permanent and cascades to related data

List all users in the system with pagination.

**Permissions:** Admin only

**Use Cases:**
- User management dashboard
- User analytics
- Account status monitoring

Get comprehensive profile and activity information for a specific user.

**Includes:**
- Complete user profile (name, email, role, assigned restaurant)
- Account status and activity flags
- Recent order history (last orders)
- Saved payment methods
- Account creation and update timestamps

**Permissions:** Admin only

**Use Cases:**
- Customer support investigations
- Account verification
- User behavior analysis

Update user information.

**Permissions:** Admin only

**Updatable Fields:**
- **role**: User's system role (ADMIN, MANAGER, MEMBER)
- **restaurantId**: Restaurant ID assignment for managers/members (must be valid restaurant ID)
- **isActive**: Account active status (true/false)

**Restaurant Assignment:**
- Required for managers and members
- Must be an existing restaurant ID from the database
- Valid examples: `restaurant-india-1`, `restaurant-america-1`
- System validates restaurant existence before update

**Use Cases:**
- Promote user to manager and assign restaurant
- Reassign manager/member to different restaurant
- Deactivate user account
- Change user role and permissions

**Validation:**
- Returns "Restaurant not found" error if restaurantId doesn't exist
- Prevents invalid foreign key references

Permanently delete a user account.

**Permissions:** Admin only

**Warning:**
- This action cannot be undone
- Will cascade delete related data
- Consider deactivating instead of deleting for data retention
